greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = lcm(A003557(n), A173557(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to lcm's
mathematica: a[n_] := If[n == 1, 1, Module[{f=FactorInteger[n]}, LCM[ Times@@ (First[#] ^(Last[#]-1)& /@  f), Times@@((#-1)& @@@ f)]]]; Array[a, 120] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Dec 05 2018 *)
program: A003557(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 2] = f[i, 2]-1); factorback(f); }; \\ From A003557
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 05 2018
